order_id.description: The unique id for this order

portfolio_id.description: The id of the portfolio that this order was created in'

product_id.description: The product this order was created for e.g. 'BTC-USD'

side.description: The side of the market that the order is on e.g. 'BUY', 'SELL'

status.description: The current state of the order

created_time.description: Timestamp for when the order was created

completion_percentage.description: Completion percentage of order, as a stringified float. Value will be an empty string if percentage cannot be calculated.

filled_size.description: Total filled size, in base currency

filled_value.description: Total filled value, in quote currency

total_value_after_fees.description: derived field: filled_value + total_fees for buy orders and filled_value - total_fees for sell orders.

product_type.description: Product type of this order's product

sole_venue_id.description: sole_venue_id of this order's product. (Empty for products that are not necessarily tied to a single venue.)

last_fill_time.description: Time of the most recent fill for this order

edit_history.description: An array of the latest 5 edits per order

coinbase.brokerage.proxy.common.Order.description:
This is the shared type for how orders are presented
to the external world by the order read and order historical proxy API.

coinbase.brokerage.proxy.common.OrderExe.title:
The UI currently has a different notion of
order execution state that is used for filtering
from the core order status.
See order/shared/transform package

coinbase.brokerage.proxy.common.RejectRe.description: - REJECT_REASON_PRICE_MARKETABLE: The price crossed the far touch. Used when post_only=true and the order would have executed immediately.
coinbase.brokerage.proxy.common.RejectRe.title: Reject reason the reason the pending order was rejected

coinbase.brokerage.proxy.events.material.title: CancelReason the reason the order was canceled
SOR Limit Fill or Kill Order
SOR Taker Limit Order Immediate or Cancel
TWAP Limit Order Good Till Date
VWAP Limit Order Good Till Date
Prime to Exchange block trade counter-party

start.description: The date/time in which the candle started. This is a UNIX ts string, '1596640920'

low.description: The lowest value for which a trade executed during this candle's time frame

high.description: The highest value for which a trade executed during this candle's time frame

open.description: The price of the product at the beginning of the candle's timeframe

close.description: The price of the product at the end of the candle's timeframe

volume.description: How much asset was traded during this timeframe, represented in base

candles.description: Collection of candles, ordered by time, each holding the high, open, low and close prices for a specific timeframe

last.description: The last (current) price - if not present, the average of the lowest bid and the highest ask (i.e., (lowest bid + highest ask) / 2)

bid_l2.description: Array of bid [price, size] pairs, sorted in price desc order

ask_l2.description: Array of ask [price, size] pairs, sorted in price asc order

mid_market.description: Calculated as (lowest ask price + highest bid price) / 2

spread_bps.description: Calculated in bps as ((lowest ask price - highest bid price) / lowest ask price) * 10000

spread_absolute.description: Difference between best ask and best bid prices. Calculated as lowest ask price - highest bid price

venue.description: The venue this product trades on. Eg: cme, cde

contract_code.description: The group identifier for this contract. Eg: MBT, MET

contract_expiry.description: The expiration timestamp of this product. Eg: 2022-06-16T00:00:00Z

contract_size.description: The size of each contract in terms of the contract root unit. Eg: 100

contract_root_unit.description: The root unit to describe the underlying instrument. Eg: BTC, ETH

group_description.description: The descriptive name for the product group. Eg: Nano Bitcoin, Micro Ethereum, etc

contract_expiry_timezone.description: The IANA time zone for the contract's expiration time. Eg: Europe/London, America/Chicago, etc

group_short_description.description: The short version of the group description. Eg: Nano BTC, Micro ETH, etc

risk_managed_by.description: The party responsible for risk management of the product. E.g. FCM or VENUE

contract_expiry_type.description: The type of contract expiry for the product. E.g. EXPIRING or PERPETUAL

funding_interval.description: The time between funding payments for perpetual futures. E.g. 1 hour. Nil for expiring futures.

max_leverage.description: The maximum leverage allowed for the product. E.g. '5' for 5x leverage. empty string for expiring futures.

price_levels.description: Array of price levels: [price, ask_size, ask_sum_size, bid_size, bid_sum_size], sorted in price desc order.

price_levels_mid_index.description: The index of the mid-price level for the price levels. If the mid-price is between two levels, the index will round down to the closest level. If no levels are returned it will return 0.

price.description: The price of the associated orders

ask_size.description: The sum of all ask orders at this associated price

ask_sum_size.description: The sum of all ask orders inclusive from the lowest ask price to this associated price

bid_size.description: The sum of all bid orders at this associated price

bid_sum_size.description: The sum of all bid orders inclusive from the highest bid price to this associated price

lift_ask.description: The weighted price that can accommodate the order amount, otherwise it returns an error. If the order amount is 0 it will return the lowest ask.

hit_bid.description: The weighted price that can accommodate the order amount, otherwise it returns an error. If the order amount is 0 it will return the highest bid.

spread.description: Calculated as lift_ask - hit_bid, otherwise it returns an error.

spread_bps.description: Calculated as ((lift_ask - hit_bid) / lift_ask) * 10000, otherwise returns an error.

future_product_stats.description: Market data stats for a FUTURES specific product. Not present for a SPOT product

latest_adjusted_price.description: Price after latest adjustment. Empty if there are no adjustments.

latest_adjusted_size.description: Size after latest adjustment. Empty if there are no adjustments.

arrival_best_bid_price.description: Best bid price at order arrival time

arrival_best_ask_price.description: Best ask price at order arrival time

alg.description:
Required supported algorithms for servers are:
- RS1 (temp value -65535)
- RS256 (temp value -257)
- ES256 (-7) - the only stable option at this point
Server required values listed at:
https://fidoalliance.org/specs/fido-v2.0-rd-20180702/fido-server-v2.0-rd-20180702.html#other
alg.title:
Cryptographic Algorithm Identifier (COSE Algorithm Identifier).
Values registered in the IANA COSE Algorithms registry:
https://www.iana.org/assignments/cose/cose.xhtml#algorithms

coinbase.eng.prime.api.api.SettlementSta.title:
- OK: amount owing is 0, or amount owing is positive but we are prior to two hours to settlement due date
 - OVERDUE: amount owing is positive, we are after grace period due date
 - PRE_PAST_DUE: amount owing is positive, but we are within two hours before the settlement due date
 - GRACE_PERIOD: amount owing is positive, we are after settlement due date but before grace period due date

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

google.protobuf.NullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.
